page.title: 18SWIMMING LESSON IN WILDEN.
page.content: Each week we all go swimming at Mr. Prigmore's pool. It's inside and heated. We can all swim before we're six. We do front crawl, backstroke, breaststroke, and butterfly. We dive, too. Mrs. Gleave teaches us. We win badges, certificates and medals. I have got my bronze, silver, and gold, and mile because I'm nearly nine. After the lesson if we've been good, we have playtime, and play with balls and the raft. The pool is quite deep, and we have to go in groups. Girls wear swimming caps. Boys don't though. My brother often needs the toilet. He's lucky because there is one. The infants are lucky, they don't have to swim so hard. Our parents transport us there in cars with our teacher, and help to dry us. We go in for Galas and win shields sometimes. It is good fun.
